qas.question: Where did gag cartoons first make an appearance?
When did gag single-panel illustrations become known as cartoons?
In which publication was cartoon first used to describe gag single-panel illustrations?
Where did gag cartoons last make an appearance?
Where did serious cartoons first make an appearance?
When did serious single-panel illustrations become known as cartoons?
When did gag single-panel illustrations become known as comics?
In which publication was cartoon last used to describe gag single-panel illustrations?

context: Gag and editorial cartoons usually consist of a single panel, often incorporating a caption or speech balloon. Definitions of comics which emphasize sequence usually exclude gag, editorial, and other single-panel cartoons; they can be included in definitions that emphasize the combination of word and image. Gag cartoons first began to proliferate in broadsheets published in <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>Europe<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the term "cartoon"[h] was first used to describe them in <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>1843<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> in the British humour magazine <a2_0><b7_0>Punch<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
